sub_title: Consulting on systems change | regeneration | climate | circular economy | cities | landscapes
summary:
Boldly chart new paths forward to bring about transformational change...

Sustainability professional with strong international experience across developed and developing economies. Breadth and depth of knowledge. Systems thinker. 

Positions held in Netherlands, Brazil, Australia, Chile, Beijing/China, and Hong Kong. MSc and MBA (Innovation, Enterprise and the Circular Economy, Bradford - No. 1 distance-learning MBA 2020, Financial Times). LEED AP since 2008. In addition, 2 decades of experience as a tour leader (casual position) covering most continents. 

Currently collaborating with international NGOs, funders, and regranters in US & Europe on a freelance basis. Open to international job opportunities.

Keen interest in enabling / operating systems (economic, societal, governance), business case & compelling narrative for transformational change - regenerative economy - sustainable cities & mobility - circular & restorative models - energy transition - natural capital, nature based solutions and value chains - and much more!

Combinig strong analytical skills with strategic and commercial acumen. Well-versed in relationship cultivation, program and project management, strategy development, operational design, organizational management. Lead author. Pro-active and versatile, knowledge savvy, creative, committed and energetic. Selection of articles & publications via renildebecque.wordpress.com/

Languages: Dutch, English, Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese; basics of German, French

profile_positions.location: The Netherlands; Hong Kong SAR; Beijing, China
profile_positions.description:
Current or recent clients include:

- World Resources Institute (WRI) incl. Platform for Accelerating Circular Economy (PACE), Coalition for Urban Transitions (CUT), and WRI Ross Prize for Cities
- European Climate Foundation (ECF)
- Laudes Foundation incl. Built by Nature (BbN)
- BMW Foundation
- Club of Rome
- We Mean Business Coalition
- Good Energies Foundation
- Overseas Development Institute (ODI)
- The Climate Group (TCG)
- World Economic Forum (WEF)
- World Bank
- United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)
- United Nations Environment Program (UNEP)
- Capital Institute
- Leaders Quest
- ClimateWorks Foundation (CWF)
- Kigali Cooling Efficiency Program (K-CEP)
- Children's Investment Fund Foundation (CIFF)
- Natural Resource Defense Council (NRDC)
- Rocky Mountain Institute (RMI)
- Carbon War Room (CWR)
- Carbon Neutral Cities Alliance (CNCA)
- Sustainable Energy for All (SEforAll)
- C40 Cities Climate Leadership Group (C40)
- Smart Freight Centre (SFC)
- World Future Council (WFC)
- SYSTEMIQ
- Sum of Us

Working with international NGOs, funders, and regranters. Assignments involving strategy & program / portfolio development, organizational design & set-up, coalition building, research, lead author/editor, outreach, policy advocacy design, project/program management, fundraising support, theory of change & UVP, stakeholder engagement, event facilitation. 

Topics include e.g. systems change & enabling systems (economic, societal, and governance), circular economy, embodied carbon, zero carbon buildings, energy transition, plastics phase-out, low-carbon cities, (access to) cooling, clean shipping, urban mobility, nature based solutions, etc.

Project Drawdown fellow

Preceded by temporary contracting (full/part-time) for:
- Mott MacDonald, Hong Kong (2013/14)
- ERM, Beijing, China (2012)

Several publications on https://renildebecque.wordpress.com/
profile_positions.title: Sr. International Sustainability & Systems Change Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Tour leader (casual position) for Dutch travel companies Djoser (current), and previously Sawadee and Baobab. Leading 8-30 day itineraries (8-22 pax) covering destinations around the world. 

Regions: Asia, Latin-America, Africa, Oceania, Europe
profile_positions.title: Tourleader

profile_positions.description:
I acted as the course proctor or 'engagement lead' for an 8-week course (plus preparation/post-course evaluation) on Introduction to Regenerative Economics, provided by The Capital Institute and delivered by Regen Designers.

The course attracted over 300 participants, representing e.g. corporates, impact investors, NGOs, government, academics, start-ups, consultancies, and more. All participants were invited to take part in "study pods", small study groups with self-assigned facilitators, to stimulate deeper discussion on the weekly course content supported with specific prompts to get the conversation started. 

As course proctor I oversaw the study pod experience with more than 40 study pods, which included weekly drop-in calls for study pod facilitators, in which ideas and feedback were solicited & discussed on topics regarding the course and movement building. This in turn was used to help inform and adapt the course as it was being delivered, as well as future course runs.
profile_positions.title: Course proctor / engagement lead - Regenerative Economics course

profile_positions.description:
Selected as one of 12 fellows for the first cohort of the Project Drawdown fellowship.

Project Drawdown is aimed at 'drawing down' the level of greenhouse gas emissions in the atmosphere rather than merely stabilizing them. The project has been initiated by Paul Hawken, a well-known American eco-entrepreneur and author of books such as Natural Capitalism and The Ecology of Commerce.

Researched Truck Fuel Efficiency, Building Energy Efficiency Retrofitting and Cycling Infrastructure.

Attended COP21 in Paris (December 2015) on behalf of Project Drawdown.

http://www.drawdown.org/current-fellows
profile_positions.title: Fellow for Paul Hawken's "Project Drawdown"

profile_positions.description:
Sustainability / Management Consulting teams. Arup is a consultancy and engineering firm with 10,000+ employees, well known for innovative design and a forward-thinking approach.

Sustainability in the urban environment: 
- Climate Resilient Cities; Sustainable Precincts
- Spatial Policy and Carbon Reduction; Carbon Footprinting
- Integrated Public Transport
- Waste Management (incl. feasibility for AWT)
- Business Development and Acquisition
(Redundancy - last in, postponed by securing 100% billability on major transport project)

Countries: Australia

(Redundancy - last in, postponed by securing 100% billability on 2 consecutive projects, incl. 10 week assignment to SKM's Chile office)

profile_positions.title: Senior Sustainability Consultant (Melbourne)

profile_positions.description:
Royal HaskoningDHV (formerly known as Royal Haskoning) is a major Dutch consultancy and engineering firm with 8000+ employees.

International assignments such as:
- SEA, REA and CEA assessments (e.g. interplay of proposed major infrastructure corridors and urban/economic development plans in relatively pristine regions with high biodiversity values and indigenous peoples)
-  Environmental due diligence, ESIA assessments (ports, waste, road / water transport, land reclamation)
- Integrated waste management (medical, industrial, commercial)
- Sustainability assessments 
- Carbon management; CO2 emission trading (EU-ETS capacity building)
- Natural resource management and climate change . 
- Green Building
- Business Development / Acquisition 

Clients: International Finance Institutions (e.g. World Bank, IADB, ADB, EIB), major developers, resource corporates, governments

Countries: Suriname, Guyana, Central and Eastern Europe, Albania, Aruba, Cape Verde, PNG, Cameroon, Oman, Dubai, Gabon, Nigeria
